intro: Mecopus, commonly known as the purple coneflower, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, violet to purple petals surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, which attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Mecopus typically grows in prairies and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soil and full sun. It is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological benefits in native landscapes.
